Header: Former Speaker says Presidents move constitutional
Content: Former Speaker W.J.M. Lokubandara says that the President can not only prorogue the Parliament but he can also prorogue again on the day it convenes, according to his powers.  Participating at a media briefing he said that these powers are vested with the President by the constitution. Former Speaker W.J.M. Lokubandara says that according to the 70th Article of the constitution the President can prorogue, convene and dissolve the Parliament. He said that when the Parliament is prorogued there is no power. He said that only the President who prorogued the Parliament can end it and no one else can do it.
